subject: RE: [junit] jWebUnit
msgSnippet: ... Ilja, I think you see where I m coming from: We decided to give jWebUnit a try. We are going to write a test class per use case. They will be integrated in
messageBody:
> I don't think you can write fine grained "unit tests" with jWebUnit. If
> I remember correctly, it was proposed as an alternative to HttpUnit,
> which isn't a unit testing framework either (despite its name).

Ilja,

I think you see where I'm coming from:

We decided to give jWebUnit a try. We are going to write a test class per use
case. They will be integrated in our continuous build environment. When there
is a defect in a use case:
- If the test isn't correct, we will modify it to fail
- If the test isn't there, we will create it to fail
Then we'll fix the defect and the test will complete successfully. At the end,
we have a full regression test covering old defects.
Any comments?

- Yagiz Erkan -
http://yagiz.blogspot.com
http://www.erkans.com
